title: Coronavirus: False claims by politicians debunked
description: Reality Check tackles coronavirus claims made by leading politicians.

title: Coronavirus: Should I wear a mask to stop the virus?
description: The BBC's Laura Foster looks at the science about when and where we should wear face masks.

title: Coronavirus: Major UK takeaway chains start to reopen
description: Burger King, KFC and Pret A Manger announce limited openings after shutting at the lockdown's start.

title: Coronavirus: The unexpected items deemed 'essential'
description: Cheese shops and gun stores are among the services still open in locked down places around the world.

title: Coronavirus: 'Bonkers' response to toilet roll art challenge
description: Masterpieces of convenience are being created during the lockdown as artists turn to loo roll tubes.

title: Seafarers in limbo as coronavirus hits shipping
description: The shipping industry is already feeling the impact of Covid-19 as the world heads for recession.

title: ‘Coronavirus has robbed me of my dream job’
description: Young people in the UK were set to enter a hot job market. Coronavirus changed all that.

title: Coronavirus: Walsall mum on life in lockdown with eight kids
description: Care worker Caroline and her partner Kevin are coming up with ways to occupy the family at home.

title: Coronavirus: Pregnant nurse dies but baby 'well' after delivery
description: "Highly valued and loved" Mary Agyeiwaa Agyapong died in hospital in Luton on Sunday.

title: World Health Organization: What is the WHO and what does it do?
description: President Trump has been critical - but what do others think of the "global guardian of public health"?

title: Belsen 1945: Remembering the medical students who saved lives
description: Two weeks after liberation, 95 London medical students arrived at Belsen to help care for survivors.

title: Coronavirus: 'You clap for me' film celebrates ethnic minority workers
description: The video's director tells the BBC why he featured doctors, delivery drivers, nurses and teachers.

title: Meet the drumming BBC weather presenter
description: Owain Wyn Evans finishes his weather forecast by playing along to the BBC News theme tune.

title: Publish lockdown exit strategy this week - Starmer
description: Labour urges clarity - but ministers say is too soon to talk about easing coronavirus restrictions.

title: Quarter of Scottish coronavirus deaths in care homes
description: New figures from the National Records of Scotland suggest a total of 962 deaths have been linked to Covid-19.

title: 'My firm is viable – but I can’t get a loan'
description: Businesses say coronavirus loans are being approved too slowly to help firms hit by lockdown measures.

title: Coronavirus: More tests promised for care homes
description: The health secretary pledges tests for all staff and residents with coronavirus symptoms.

title: Coronavirus: Denmark lets young children return to school
description: Children up to the age of 11 go back to class more than a month after their schools were shut down.

title: Tour de France delayed until August
description: The postponed 2020 Tour de France will now start on 29 August, following the French government's extension of a ban on mass gatherings.

title: Coronavirus: Insurance firms ordered to pay out or explain
description: The Financial Conduct Authority says insurers must pay out to firms "as soon as possible".

title: HS2 construction gets green light despite lockdown
description: The government has given the high-speed rail project formal approval to start construction.

title: How Drake harnessed TikTok to slide to number one
description: Tik Tok emerged as a powerful way to break new music. Now established acts are paying attention.

title: Gossip: Inter want Griezmann, Real want Kante
description: Inter will want Griezmann for Martinez, Manchester City revive Semedo interest, Real Madrid target Chelsea's Kante, plus more.

title: Coronavirus: US to halt funding to WHO, says Trump
description: The World Health Organization "failed in its basic duty" over coronavirus, Donald Trump says.

title: BBC Sport's five things to do today
description: Our team give you something to read, watch, try, listen and take - all in one place.

title: What should happen to Premier League season? Pundits' views and vote
description: A festival of football and average points are among the suggestions for getting the Premier League season finished - BBC pundits explore the options.

title: The Papers: 'Grim' economic forecast shows 'dark days ahead'
description: A watchdog's bleak warning of the potential effect of coronavirus dominates Wednesday's papers.

title: Cyclone Harold and coronavirus: Pacific Islands face battle on two fronts
description: Aid agencies warn the aftermath of Cyclone Harold in Pacific nations risks undoing their virus prevention.

title: Do celebrities still matter in a crisis?
description: The role of celebrities in this crisis - how much do we listen to them?
